com.ibm.avatar.api.tam

Interface DictionaryMetadata

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable

    public interface DictionaryMetadata
extends Serializable
    This class provides APIs to retrieve dictionary metadata for the exported and the external dictionaries of a given module. An instance of DictionaryMetadata can be obtained by the API: ModuleMetadata.getDictionaryMetadata(String).
    See Also:
    ModuleMetadata

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CaseSensitivityType getCaseType()
      Returns whether dictionary matches should be case-sensitive or not.
      String getComment()
      Returns the text of the AQL doc comment associated with this dictionary.
      String getDictName()
      Returns the unqualified dictionary name as declared in create dictionary or create external dictionary statement.
      String getLanguages()
      Returns the list of language codes used for tokenizing this dictionary.
      Boolean isAllowEmpty()
      Deprecated. 
      As of v3.0.1, use isRequired() instead
      boolean isExported()
      Specifies whether the dictionary is exported.
      boolean isExternal()
      Specifies whether the dictionary is internal (defined by create dictionary)
      or external (defined by create external dictionary)
      boolean isLemmaMatch()
      Specifies whether the dictionary is matched on lemma (i.e., it was defined using the lemma_match setting).
      Boolean isRequired()
      Specifies whether dictionary filename needs to be specified.

    • Method Detail

      • getDictName

        String getDictName()
        Returns the unqualified dictionary name as declared in create dictionary or create external dictionary statement.
        Returns:
        the unqualified dictionary name as declared in create dictionary or create external dictionary statement

      • getLanguages

        String getLanguages()
        Returns the list of language codes used for tokenizing this dictionary.
        Returns:
        comma-separated list of language code

      • getCaseType

        CaseSensitivityType getCaseType()
        Returns whether dictionary matches should be case-sensitive or not.
        For example, if the case type is exact, "Miller" would not match "miller".
        Returns:
        One of the following case types: exact, insensitive

      • isExternal

        boolean isExternal()
        Specifies whether the dictionary is internal (defined by create dictionary)
        or external (defined by create external dictionary)
        Returns:
        true, if the dictionary is external

      • isExported

        boolean isExported()
        Specifies whether the dictionary is exported.
        Returns:
        true, if the dictionary is exported.

      • isAllowEmpty

        @Deprecated
Boolean isAllowEmpty()
        Deprecated. As of v3.0.1, use isRequired() instead
        Specifies whether empty external dictionaries are allowed. This method will throw an exception if called for a non-external dictionary.
        Returns:
        true, if dictionary contents are optional
        false, if not
        null, if undefined (the required flag was set)
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if invoked on the internal dictionary metadata instance

      • isRequired

        Boolean isRequired()
        Specifies whether dictionary filename needs to be specified. This method will throw an exception if called for a non-external dictionary.
        Returns:
        true, if a dictionary filename needs to be specified
        false, if not
        null, if undefined (the deprecated allow_empty flag was set)
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if invoked on the internal dictionary metadata instance

      • isLemmaMatch

        boolean isLemmaMatch()
        Specifies whether the dictionary is matched on lemma (i.e., it was defined using the lemma_match setting).
        Returns:
        true, if the dictionary is matched on lemma
        false, otherwise

      • getComment

        String getComment()
        Returns the text of the AQL doc comment associated with this dictionary. The text of the original comment is processed as follows:
        • Leading comment separator (/**) and trailing comment separator (*/) are removed
        • Leading asterisk (*) characters on each line are discarded; blanks and tabs preceding the initial asterisk (*) characters are also discarded. If you omit the leading asterisk on a line, the leading white space is not removed.
        • Carriage return characters (\r) are removed.
        Returns:
        the text of the AQL doc comment with leading (begin AQL doc comment) and trailing (end AQL doc comment) separators discarded, leading consecutive whitespace followed by an asterisk on each line of the comment also discarded, carriage return characters (\r) also discarded
